content: check this video tutorial 2 version https //www youtube com/watch v=p- qlgfpxyqw&ab_channel=roxannerichardson measurements @karlijnscorner this pattern is made to measure which means we will be taking our own measurements throughout the pattern and will not be following specific row or stitch counts for guidance with measuring refer to the photos below all references will be in a size medium with the mentioned gauge measurement a neckline circumference measure around your neck measurement b your desired neck strap width measurement c armhole depth from your collarbones to the underside of your armpits measurement d bust measurement around the widest part of your bust instagram @karlijnscorner e-mail karlijnscorner@gmail com #thetankyouverymuchtop gauge swatch @karlijnscorner since this pattern is made to measure you will need to make a gauge swatch this way you can calculate the amount of stitches you need to co start by making a 4 x4 gauge swatch in stockinette i like to make it a little bigger so i can clearly count the sts count the amount of sts that are within the 4 reference 4 = 27 sts now take your measurement a and your number of sts and do some math take your number of sts and divide by 4 reference 27/4 = 6 75 sts now take your measurement a in inches and multiple with your st number from above reference 15 x6 75= 101 25 round your number up/down to a number divisible by 4 this will be your number of co stitches reference 100 sts instagram @karlijnscorner e-mail karlijnscorner@gmail com #thetankyouverymuchtop instructions @karlijnscorner co the amount of stitches you have calculated using the method on the previous page + 1 you can do this using any cast on method i prefer the long tail cast on round 1 join your stitches in the round by knitting the first st and slipping the last co st over your knitted stitch this is your first purl st of the round pm before this stitch make sure your sts aren t twisted when you join them in the round p1 *k2 p2* repeat * until the end of the round round 2-10 continue in rib *p2 k2* in the round until you reach your measurement b reference 10 rounds of rib round 11 devide your sts in 2 and pm in the middle both sides should have an even amount of sts bobble 10 sts in pattern continue your 2x2 rib until you reach the middle of your work/your marker bobble 10 sts and continue 2x2 rib until the end of the round break your yarn and put one side on a stitch holder or a piece of scrap yarn back row 1 rs repeat 2x2 rib twice 8 sts pm m1r work 2x2 rib until 8 sts until the end m1l and pm repeat 2x2 rib twice 8 sts row 2 ws work 2x2 rib until the end of the row row 3 rs work 2x2 rib until your marker sm and m1r work 2x2 rib until
